description: Let f(1) = 1, f(2) = 1 + i (where i denotes the imaginary unit), and for n > 1, f(n+1) is the Gaussian integer in the first quadrant (with positive real part and nonnegative imaginary part) with least modulus and sharing a prime factor with f(n) (in case of a tie, minimize the imaginary part); a(n) = the real part of f(n).
